Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Reverend Dr. Timothy P. Mitchell, Ebenezer Missionary Baptist Church, 36-12 Prince Street, Flushing, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER LIU.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Dr. Timothy P. Mitchell, Ebenezer Missionary Baptist Church, 36-12 Prince Street, Flushing, New York.

Council Member Liu moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 30, 2003 be adopted and printed by Council Member Yassky.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Yassky moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of  April 30, 2003 adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the local finance law, in relation to the sale of bonds and notes of the city of New York, the refunding of bonds and the down payment for projects financed by bonds; and to amend the New York state financial emergency act for the city of New York, in relation to a pledge and agreement of the state".  S.5213/A8692
Items.MatterName: Sale of bonds and notes of the city of New York.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750 or where taxes are held in escrow or where parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land, and nine percent (9%) in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Water and Sewer Rents, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2004, pursuant to Section 1519 of the City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for FY'04.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750, or vacant or unimproved land; and non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health be 18 percent (18%) for Fiscal Year 2004.
Items.MatterName: Orders of the Board of Health or Dept of Health, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting resolution recommending that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 or where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid by a mortgage escrow agent be eighteen percent (18%), and nine percent (9%) in all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for FY'04 for non-payment of taxes on real property.

Items.MatterName: LU 361 - ULURP, Anchor W. 116th St. Phase III, Manhattan (C030245HAM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving an Urban Development Action Area Project located at 592 Greene Avenue (Block 1799/Lot 37), Brooklyn, and waiving the urban development action area designation requirement and the Uniform Land Use Review Procedure, pursuant to Sections 693 and 694 of the General Municipal Law (L.U. No. 442; 20035212 HAK).

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Communication from the Mayor  - "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed and reporting upon the use of a traffic-control signal photo-monitoring system and to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989, amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the duration of the application of provisions of such code, such chapter and such law". S.2472/A.4806
Items.MatterName: Intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed (S.2472/A.4806)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the local finance law, in relation to the sale of bonds and notes of the city of New York, the refunding of bonds and the down payment for projects financed by bonds; and to amend the New York state financial emergency act for the city of New York, in relation to a pledge and agreement of the state".  S.5213/A8692
Items.MatterName: Sale of bonds and notes of the city of New York.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1776, and Assembly Member Nolan, A.3934, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to Theodore M. Renz, sole heir-at-law and distributee of former owners Rudolph Renz and Johanna Renz".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Theodore Renz, Queens (S.1776, A.3934)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Velella, S.4184, and Committee on Rules, A.7866, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of the NYCERS (S.4184, A.7866)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Maltese, Marchi and Mendez, S.1475, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Pheffer, Seddio and Weisenberg, et al, A.3156, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel".
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired NYC police personnel (S.1475, A.3156)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Velella, S.3967, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6797, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to special accidental death benefits payable to the dependents of deceased police and fire members".
Items.MatterName: Special accidental death benefits payable to the dependents of deceased police and fire members (S.3967, A.6797)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4124, and Committee on Rules, A.7919, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties (S.4124, A.7919)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Skelos, S.2124-A, and Assembly Members DiNapoli, Hooper, Sidikman and Weisenberg, A.6064, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to allowing the transfer of membership from the New York city police pension fund to the metropolitan transportation authority police pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Allowing the transfer of membership from the NYC police pension fund to the metropolitan transportation authority police pension fund (S.2124-A, A.6064)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Robach, S.2980-A, and Assembly Members Abbate and Klein, A.6802-B, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as water supply police; and to amend the retirement and social security law and the general municipal law, in relation to benefits for such members who are injured in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed as water supply police (S.2980-A, A.6802-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4123, and Committee on Rules, A.7920, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as urban park rangers and associate urban park rangers; and to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to including in a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as urban park rangers and associate park rangers who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of such law".
Items.MatterName: Twenty-five year retirement program for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed as urban park rangers and associate urban park rangers (S.4123, A.7920)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.4258, and Committee on Rules, A.8668, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police and fire department personnel".
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law. (S.4258, A.8668)

Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the criteria used to determine when to launch an immediate investigation into the whereabouts of a missing person to include a person 25 years-of-age and under, and whether an absence is inconsistent with a person’s usual patterns, habits and schedule as known by friends, acquaintances or family.
Items.MatterName: Expanding the criteria used to determine when to launch an immediate investigation into the whereabouts of a missing person.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold a hearing on the "48-hour rule", whereby police officers under investigation as suspects are not required to speak to anyone about the incident for a 48-hour period.
Items.MatterName: Police officers under investigation as suspects are not required to speak to anyone about the incident for a 48-hour period.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter and administrative code of the city of New York with respect to transferring functions of the department of employment and the administration for children's services to the department of social services, the department of small business services and the department of youth and community development, and to  repeal  chapter 73 of the charter.
Items.MatterName: Transferring functions of DOE and ACS.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.2669, and Committee on Rules, A.8588, "AN ACT in relation to authorizing the city of New York to sell real property consisting of vacant land owned by such city known as Bennett's Lane in the borough of Brooklyn designated as Block 6362, Lot 100 on the tax map of the city of New York for the borough of Brooklyn and property consisting of vacant land owned by such city formerly known as Bennett's Lane Brooklyn, Greenwood & Bath Plank Road, designated as Block 6369, Lot 125 on the tax map of the city of New York for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Bennett's Lane, Brooklyn (S.2669, A.8588)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to apprenticeship training programs for city construction contractors.
Items.MatterName: Apprenticeship training programs for city construction contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of outdoor advertising and repealing sections 5, 6, 7 and 8 of  local law 14 for the year 2001 in relation thereto.
Items.MatterName: Regulation of outdoor advertising.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Mendez and Padavan, S.4183, and Committee on Rules, A.7868, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to refunding contributions made to the twenty-five-year and age fifty-five retirement program by New York city transit authority members".
Items.MatterName: Refunding contributions made to the twenty-five-year and age fifty-five retirement program by NYC transit authority members (S.4123, A.7868)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4123, and Committee on Rules, A.7920, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as urban park rangers and associate urban park rangers; and to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to including in a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as urban park rangers and associate park rangers who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of such law".
Items.MatterName: Twenty-five year retirement program for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed as urban park rangers and associate urban park rangers (S.4123, A.7920)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.8547, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the registration of property and designation of mailing address".
Items.MatterName: Registration of property and designation of mailing address (A.8547)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Velella, S.4184-A, and Committee on Rules, A.7866-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of the NYC employees' retirement system (S.4184-A, A.7866-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Marchi, Morahan, Padavan and Trunzo, S.2234-A, and Assembly Members Lavelle and Seddio, et al, A.1349-B, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York city police officers, firefighters, housing police and transit police".
Items.MatterName: Extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York City police officers, firefighters, housing police and transit police (S.2234-A, A.1349-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.4258, and Committee on Rules, A.8668, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police and fire department personnel".
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law. (S.4258, A.8668)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the distribution of a public health insurance program options pamphlet to parents and guardians of public school students.
Items.MatterName: Distribution of a public health insurance program options pamphlet to parents and guardians of public school students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to granting voluntary leaves of absence in times of fiscal crisis.
Items.MatterName: Granting voluntary leaves of absence in times of fiscal crisis.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating the crime of unlawful video surveillance.
Items.MatterName: Creating the crime of unlawful video surveillance.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the efforts of Governor Pataki and the New York State Legislature to create the crime of unlawful video surveillance and urging them to enact this important legislation before the end of the current legislative session.
Items.MatterName: Creating the crime of unlawful video surveillance.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Dilan, S.4973, and Committee on Rules, A.8397, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner George Black, or if he is deceased, to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from him or to their successors in interest, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1762, Lot No. 62 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, George Black, Brooklyn (S.4973, A.8397)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to limiting contributions by individuals, partnerships, political committees, employee organizations, corporations and other entities, which support or oppose proposals submitted for the approval of the electors.
Items.MatterName: Limiting contributions by individuals, partnerships, political committees, employee organizations, corporations and other entities.

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for Municipal Park projects, Local Waterfront Revitalization Projects, and Hudson River Estuary projects within the City of New York and the signing of associated state contracts under the appropriate laws of New York State.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the filing of applications for state assistance payments for municipal Park projects, Local Waterfront Revitalization Projects, and Hudson River Estuary projects within NYC.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 030441 HAM, an Urban Development Action Area Designation, Project, and the disposition of such property located within the Milbank Frawley Circle East Urban Renewal Area in Community Board 11, Borough of the Manhattan, Council District no. 8.  This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Milbank Frawley Circle, Manhattan (C030441HAM)

Items.Title: Application no. 20035228 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Project located at 788 Halsey Street, Council District no. 41, Borough of Brooklyn.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, 788 Halsey Street, Brooklyn (20035228HAK)

S.5030A/A.7164A
Items.MatterName: Powers, duties and responsibilities of the board of trustees of the NYC Fire Dep't Pension Fund (S.5030A/A.7164A)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to ensuring that the New York City Employees' Retirement System, the New York City Police Pension Fund, subchapter 2, the New York City Fire Department Pension Fund, subchapter 2, the New York City Teachers' Retirement System and the New York City Board of Education Retirement System are in compliance with sections 401(a) (2) and 401 (a) (9) of the Internal Revenue Code". S.5029/A.7165
Items.MatterName: Ensuring that the NYC Employees' Retirement System are in compliance with sections 401(a) (2) and 401 (a) (9) of the Internal Revenue Code". S.5029/A.7165

Items.Title: Resolutions
Discussion of Resolutions

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Velella, S.4184-A, and Committee on Rules, A.7866-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees' retirement system".

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the rate of interest imposed on underpayments of the general corporation tax and banking corporation tax.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rate of interest imposed on underpayments of the general corporation tax and banking corporation tax.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date by which if the expense budget has not been adopted, the expense budget adopted as modified for the current fiscal year shall be deemed to have been extended for the new fiscal year until such time as a new expense budget has been adopted, the date by which if a capital budget and a capital program have not been adopted, the unutilized portion of all prior capital appropriations shall be deemed reappropriated, the dates of mayoral disapprovals of Council action and Council overrides thereof, the date of submission by the Mayor of an estimate of the probable amount of receipts, the date by which if the Council has not fixed the tax rates for the ensuing fiscal year, the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to complete the assessment rolls using estimated rates, and related matters, relating to the fiscal year two thousand four.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
